meanings.definition: A curse or expression of hatred or ill-will.
meanings.sent1: She whispered maledictions under her breath, hoping no one would hear.
meanings.sent2: The witch's maledictions were feared by all in the village.
meanings.sent3: The maledictions in the fairy tale made the children gasp in surprise.
meanings.sent4: His maledictions seemed to have a power of their own, lingering in the air.
meanings.sent5: The maledictions in the old book sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.definition: The act of cursing or invoking evil upon someone.
meanings.sent1: The maledictions of the sorcerer were said to bring misfortune to those who crossed him.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of dread as the maledictions echoed through the dark forest.
meanings.sent3: The maledictions in the play were so dramatic, they made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The maledictions of the storm seemed to shake the very foundations of the house.
meanings.sent5: His maledictions were like dark clouds looming over the peaceful town.
